values.description:

This pull-request removes the `filename` component from the `heightmapgeom.proto` file.

I'll merge this pull request up the chain (gazebo_2.1, then default), and then submit a new pull request to default with the breaking `heightmapgeom.proto` file.

values.description:
This script automates the API/ABI checker steps described in the [wiki](http://gazebosim.org/wiki/Abi_checker).  Usage is simple:

    cd gazebo
    ./tools/api_checker.bash .

Notes:

* It takes a bit of time to run, due in part to the separate build of Gazebo (hopefully accelerated by ccache) and in part to the time required by the api/abi checker itself.
* It assumes that you want to check compatibility with the currently released version of Gazebo.
* It assumes that your working copy and the system install agree in major.minor (for the purposes of finding headers).

The last two limitations could be removed with the addition of some logic and a couple of command-line arguments.

If this script is useful, we should consider:

* merging it forward to gazebo_2.0 and default;
* adding a similar script to sdformat; and
* generalizing it for use on other packages (might be complicated by details of header locations and knowledge of which headers to skip).
values.title: add api_checker script

Notes:

* It takes a bit of time to run, due in part to the separate build of Gazebo (hopefully accelerated by ccache) and in part to the time required by the api/abi checker itself.
* It assumes that you want to check compatibility with the currently released version of Gazebo.
* It assumes that your working copy and the system install agree in major.minor (for the purposes of finding headers).

The last two limitations could be removed with the addition of some logic and a couple of command-line arguments.

If this script is useful, we should consider:

* adding a similar script to sdformat; and
* generalizing it for use on other packages (might be complicated by details of header locations and knowledge of which headers to skip).
summary.html:
This script automates the API/ABI checker steps described in the wiki. Usage is simple:

cd gazebo
./tools/api_checker.bash .

Notes:

  • It takes a bit of time to run, due in part to the separate build of Gazebo (hopefully accelerated by ccache) and in part to the time required by the api/abi checker itself.
  • It assumes that you want to check compatibility with the currently released version of Gazebo.
  • It assumes that your working copy and the system install agree in major.minor (for the purposes of finding headers).

The last two limitations could be removed with the addition of some logic and a couple of command-line arguments.

If this script is useful, we should consider:

  • merging it forward to gazebo_2.0 and default;
  • adding a similar script to sdformat; and
  • generalizing it for use on other packages (might be complicated by details of header locations and knowledge of which headers to skip).

values.description:
The strings returned by common::get_sha1 were not always 40 characters on OSX, since some of the '0's were being dropped from the middle of the digest string. This adds to the test and provides a fix.

To replicate the failure, build e19d123 and run the UNIT_CommonIface_TEST.
values.title: Fix get_sha1 os OS X (#894)

summary.raw:
The strings returned by common::get_sha1 were not always 40 characters on OSX, since some of the '0's were being dropped from the middle of the digest string. This adds to the test and provides a fix.

To replicate the failure, build e19d123 and run the UNIT_CommonIface_TEST.
summary.html:
The strings returned by common::get_sha1 were not always 40 characters on OSX, since some of the '0's were being dropped from the middle of the digest string. This adds to the test and provides a fix.

To replicate the failure, build e19d123 and run the UNIT_CommonIface_TEST.

values.description:
I ran the following three commands:

`find . -name "*.cc" -exec sed -i -e 's/Copyright 2012 Open Source Robotics/Copyright 2013 Open Source Robotics/g' {} \;`

`find . -name "*.hh" -exec sed -i -e 's/Copyright 2012 Open Source Robotics/Copyright 2013 Open Source Robotics/g' {} \;`

`find . -name "*.h" -exec sed -i -e 's/Copyright 2012 Open Source Robotics/Copyright 2013 Open Source Robotics/g' {} \;`

and also edited LICENSE.

I targeted this to gazebo_2.0 because I think it's a special case where our copyright should be up-to-date, and it doesn't touch any actual code.
values.title: Change copyright to 2013

and also edited LICENSE.

I targeted this to gazebo_2.0 because I think it's a special case where our copyright should be up-to-date, and it doesn't touch any actual code.

values.description:
Currently cppcheck is not being run on gazebo's header files, even though many of them contain inline and template functions. Running the checks on the header files causes some false positives, some of which can be suppressed though the suppression file, though one error is more vexing. It can only be suppressed with version 1.57 of cppcheck (ie. raring or later). So I have added logic in the code_check script to only run cppcheck on header files if the cppcheck version is sufficiently recent.

Note, this fix is motivated by #906, which caused the osx build to break. In order to properly fix #906, I will add a new cppcheck rule file, but it needs to run on header files.
values.title: Fix #907: enable cppcheck for header files

summary.raw:
Currently cppcheck is not being run on gazebo's header files, even though many of them contain inline and template functions. Running the checks on the header files causes some false positives, some of which can be suppressed though the suppression file, though one error is more vexing. It can only be suppressed with version 1.57 of cppcheck (ie. raring or later). So I have added logic in the code_check script to only run cppcheck on header files if the cppcheck version is sufficiently recent.

Note, this fix is motivated by #906, which caused the osx build to break. In order to properly fix #906, I will add a new cppcheck rule file, but it needs to run on header files.
summary.html:
Currently cppcheck is not being run on gazebo's header files, even though many of them contain inline and template functions. Running the checks on the header files causes some false positives, some of which can be suppressed though the suppression file, though one error is more vexing. It can only be suppressed with version 1.57 of cppcheck (ie. raring or later). So I have added logic in the code_check script to only run cppcheck on header files if the cppcheck version is sufficiently recent.

Note, this fix is motivated by #906, which caused the osx build to break. In order to properly fix #906, I will add a new cppcheck rule file, but it needs to run on header files.

values.description:
This is a fix for the 876_regression_test, which verifies that gazebo's random number generation is repeatable after resetting the world.

While debugging this test, I first added a test to UNIT_Rand_TEST to verify repeatability of random number generation. Then to make 876_regression_test pass, I had to reset the seed just after the world was loaded. @nkoenig indicated in the comments of #884 that this is sufficient.
values.title: Fix #884, broken 876_regression_test

summary.raw:
This is a fix for the 876_regression_test, which verifies that gazebo's random number generation is repeatable after resetting the world.

While debugging this test, I first added a test to UNIT_Rand_TEST to verify repeatability of random number generation. Then to make 876_regression_test pass, I had to reset the seed just after the world was loaded. @nkoenig indicated in the comments of #884 that this is sufficient.
summary.html:
This is a fix for the 876_regression_test, which verifies that gazebo's random number generation is repeatable after resetting the world.

While debugging this test, I first added a test to UNIT_Rand_TEST to verify repeatability of random number generation. Then to make 876_regression_test pass, I had to reset the seed just after the world was loaded. @nkoenig indicated in the comments of #884 that this is sufficient.

values.description: The build is currently broken on OSX, since it apparently requires the std:: namespace prefix when calling the isinf function. The fix is easy, but I also added a cppcheck rule to help prevent future occurrences of the problem.
values.title: Fix #906: osx build broken

summary.raw: The build is currently broken on OSX, since it apparently requires the std:: namespace prefix when calling the isinf function. The fix is easy, but I also added a cppcheck rule to help prevent future occurrences of the problem.

values.description:
We've seen occasional failures on sensor noise tests that look like they're due to low-probability, but entirely possible, sampling results.  For sensors with Gaussian noise models, we test that samples fall within 3-sigma of the expected mean, which should happen [99.7% of the time](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Normal_distribution#Standard_deviation_and_tolerance_intervals).  But that means that we should expect those tests to fail 0.3% of the time.

This pull request makes the test results deterministic by first setting to a known value the seed used by Gazebo's random-number generator.  It shouldn't matter which seed we use, as long as it's one for which the tests pass.  The tests already internally collect and average many samples before applying the statistical tests.

This should also be merged to default.
values.title: Make sensor noise tests deterministic

summary.raw:
We've seen occasional failures on sensor noise tests that look like they're due to low-probability, but entirely possible, sampling results.  For sensors with Gaussian noise models, we test that samples fall within 3-sigma of the expected mean, which should happen [99.7% of the time](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Normal_distribution#Standard_deviation_and_tolerance_intervals).  But that means that we should expect those tests to fail 0.3% of the time.

This pull request makes the test results deterministic by first setting to a known value the seed used by Gazebo's random-number generator.  It shouldn't matter which seed we use, as long as it's one for which the tests pass.  The tests already internally collect and average many samples before applying the statistical tests.

This should also be merged to default.
summary.html:
We've seen occasional failures on sensor noise tests that look like they're due to low-probability, but entirely possible, sampling results. For sensors with Gaussian noise models, we test that samples fall within 3-sigma of the expected mean, which should happen 99.7% of the time. But that means that we should expect those tests to fail 0.3% of the time.

This pull request makes the test results deterministic by first setting to a known value the seed used by Gazebo's random-number generator. It shouldn't matter which seed we use, as long as it's one for which the tests pass. The tests already internally collect and average many samples before applying the statistical tests.

This should also be merged to default.

values.description:
I've added the two-steps find: first look for standard bullet.pc file and 2.82 version. If this fails, check for our custom bullet2.82.pc file.

BTW, all versions of [bullet2.82 packages](http://packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu/pool/main/b/bullet/) are in the repository and jenkins is now using them.
